STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 2, 2023
Janet Vyse-Staszak
MASON-OCEANA COUNTY DHHS
4081 W POLK RD,
HART, MI, 49420-8177
Re: License #: CP640201336
Dear Janet Vyse-Staszak:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
July 31, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CP640201336
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling
Chief Administrator: Janet Vyse-Staszak
Name of Agency: MASON-OCEANA COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 4081 W POLK RD
HART, MI 49420-8177
Agency Telephone #: 2318737251
Original Issuance Date: 06/01/1990
Service Types: Place children for adoption, Certify foster
homes for license, Supervise Independent
Living, Place children in foster home,
Evaluate Applicants for adoption
1

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member’s
performance within a probationary period or not later
than 6 months after the staff member assumes his or her
current responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a
written evaluation shall be conducted each year.
One of three personnel files reviewed did not contain written performance
evaluations as required.
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been
given an application for renewal of the license not less
than 60 calendar days before the expiration date of the
license.
One of three foster home files reviewed did not provide the licensee an application
for renewal at least 60 days prior to the expiration of the license.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2

6/9/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 7/1/2022
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have
training in and maintain a current certification in first aid
from the American Heart Association or the American
Red Cross or other institution approved by the
department.
One of three foster home files reviewed did not have current certification in first aid
as required.
CPA Rule 400.12422 Foster care record
(3) The record shall contain all of the following
information:
(g) A photograph taken at least annually.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have a photograph of the youth as
required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6/9/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 7/1/2022
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables:
Case Plan Development/Reassessment
Initial Case Plan (ISP) - within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date.
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) - within 30
calendar days before the case plan due date.
Placement Preservation/ Disruption
At least three business days prior to a planned change of
placement or no later than three business days after an
3

unplanned placement change.
Planned and unplanned placement changes include
reunification, placement in a residential setting,
stepdown from a residential or hospital setting, return
from AWOLP, or request for change in foster
home/relative placements.
Two of six foster care files reviewed did not have FTM's completed as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6/9/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 7/1/2022
6/29/2021 INTERIM, CAP approved 8/25/2021
FOM 722-06B FTM Documentation
The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for
every FTM.
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in
MiSACWIS using the FTM hyperlink within seven
business days of the FTM.
Three of six foster care files reviewed and one of two independent living files
reviewed contained FTM's without the DHS 1105 or the DHS 1105 was not
uploaded within seven business days.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6/9/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 7/1/2022
FOM 722-08C Foster Care-Parent Agency Treatment Plan & Service
Agreement
When completed, obtain all signatures as appropriate,
including those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care
worker, supervisor, foster parent, caregiver, any youth
aged 14 and older and in the case of placement agency
foster care cases, the local DHS office designee.
Three of six foster care files reviewed (7 of 20 service plans) and one of two
independent living files reviewed (1 of 9 service plans) did not contain all of the
required signatures on the parent agency treatment plan (PATP).
FOM 722-08D PATP's
4

REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6/9/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 7/1/2022
6/29/2021 INTERIM, CAP approved 8/25/2021
FOM 722-08 Supervisor approval
The supervisor must approve all case service plans
within 14 days of the end of the report period.
Two of six open foster care files reviewed did not have supervisory approval of the
case service plan within 14 days as required.
FOM 722-06H Contact with supervisor
The case manager must meet with their supervisor at
least monthly for case consultation on every assigned
case.
One of two independent living files reviewed did not have documented monthly
supervision with staff as required.
FOM 801-03 Medical passports
For children entering foster care, the initial medical
passport must be provided within two weeks of the
child's placement date to the following:
• Foster care provider.
• Young adult voluntary foster care (YAVFC) youth/young
adult re-entering foster care.
The actual date the medical passport is provided must
be documented in the electronic case management
record.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
• Participating legal parents, if the child is a temporary
court ward.
Quarterly, while in out-of-home placement.
At reunification. Subsequent medical passports are not
required after reunification.
• The child’s foster care provider:
At or prior to each placement.
• All medical and mental health professionals to whom
the child is newly referred to and accepted for treatment
5

and/or services prior to or at the first scheduled
appointment while the foster care case is open,
regardless of placement.
Subsequent medical passports are not required.
• • Older youth/young adults:
• Upon initial independent living placement (youth age 16
and over).
• Upon exiting the foster care system (young adults age
18 and older).
• Young adult voluntary foster care (YAVFC) youth/young
adult:
• Within two weeks of re-entry into voluntary foster care.
• Upon exiting voluntary foster care.
Three of six foster care files reviewed did not have medical passports and required
signatures.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6/9/2022 RENEWAL, CAP approved 7/1/2022
6/29/2021 INTERIM, CAP approved 8/25/2021
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Upload renewal letter sent to foster parents.
• Make sure date on document is accurate.
• Annotations on PATP’s need to be dated.
• Signatures on PATP’s need to be dated.
• Upload Help Desk ticket information if SOP is impacted.
• The same timeline should be used for uploading semi-annual
documentation and DHS 1105.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
6

The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan in response to the renewal
inspection completed on 6/9/2022 with a corrective action plan approved on
7/1/2022. During the review the agency had thirteen violations. Six citations were
noted as repeat violations in the current inspection. During this period under
review the agency noted that compliance was impacted, in part, by an ongoing
vacancy in licensing.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported the agency's efforts in meeting licensing requirements
during this review period. The Chief Administrator (CA) stated the agency has
been short staff in licensing for almost a year, however the agency has worked
hard to complete tasks timely and efficiently. The CA noted the agency has
experienced some challenges regarding an insufficient number of dental providers
and an overall lack of medical and dental providers that accept Medicaid.
The CA indicated the agency has implemented additional internal methods to
ensure compliance. The development of an internal tracking spreadsheet for
licensing and worker/supervisor checklist have been beneficial. The CA also noted
staff have taken a more active role in assuring proper, complete case files. The
CA expressed confidence that the agency will continue to see improvement over
the next review period.
Financial Overview
NA
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with three staff via telephone. Staff reported frustration
with managing difficult clients but recognized this is part of the job and not
reflective of the agency. Staff reported supervisors and coworkers are supportive
and willing to help out as needed. Staff reported no areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services All files were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
7

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
________7/31/2023___________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 2, 2023
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
